p: In October 2016, two sediment cores located at the eastern lake (ECH, 117°36′14.38″ E, 31°31′28.92″ N) and western lake (WCH, 117°22′20.49″ E, 31°37′50.59″ N) ( Figure 1) were collected using gravity sampling cores that were 28 cm and 29 cm in length, respectively. The general characteristics of these two cores are presented in Table 1. The sediment cores were sliced into 1 cm subsamples in situ and kept frozen by a portative cooler. After being taken to the laboratory, the samples were weighed wet, freeze-dried, then reweighed to calculate the dry bulk density.
